revised_title: The Fertilized Ovum and Formation of Layers in the South African Peripatus
tldr: The author examines the fertilized ovum of the South African Peripatus, focusing on the structure and development of the nucleus and the process of segmentation. The study reveals the continuity of the nuclear reticulum with the extra-nuclear reticulum and the similarity in structure between the spindle fibers and the surrounding reticulum, suggesting that the nucleus and cell protoplasm differ only in the behavior of chromatin within the protoplasmic meshwork.
